verses.text: Therefore thou shalt love the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, and keep his charge, and his statutes, and his judgments, and his commandments alway.

And know you \add this\add* day: for \add I speak\add* not with your children which have not known, and which have not seen the chastisement of the \sc Lord\sc* your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, and his stretched out arm,
and his miracles, and his acts, which he did in the midst of Egypt unto Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and unto all his land;

and what he did unto the army of Egypt, unto their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Red sea to overflow them as they pursued after you, and \add how\add* the \sc Lord\sc* hath destroyed them unto this day;
and what he did unto you in the wilderness, until ye came into this place;

and what he did unto Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben: how the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and their tents, and all the substance that \add was\add* in their possession, in the midst of all Israel:
but your eyes have seen all the great acts of the \sc Lord\sc* which he did.
Therefore shall ye keep all the commandments which I command you \add this\add* day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land, whither ye go to possess it;
and that ye may prolong \add your\add* days in the land, which the \sc Lord\sc* sware unto your fathers to give unto them and to their seed, a land that floweth with milk and honey.

For the land, whither thou goest in to possess it, \add is\add* not as the land of Egypt, from whence ye came out, where thou sowedst thy seed, and wateredst \add it\add* with thy foot, as a garden of herbs:
but the land, whither ye go to possess it, \add is\add* a land of hills and valleys, \add and\add* drinketh water of the rain of heaven:
a land which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God careth for: the eyes of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God \add are\add* always upon it, from the beginning of the year even unto the end of the year.

And it shall come to pass, if you shall hearken diligently unto my commandments which I command you \add this\add* day, to love the \sc Lord\sc* your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
that I will give \add you\add* the rain of your land in his due season, the first rain and the latter rain, that thou mayest gather in thy corn, and thy wine, and thine oil.
And I will send grass in thy fields for thy cattle, that thou mayest eat and be full.
Take heed to yourselves, that your heart be not deceived, and ye turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them;

and \add then\add* the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* wrath be kindled against you, and he shut up the heaven, that there be no rain, and \add that\add* the land yield not her fruit; and \add lest\add* ye perish quickly from off the good land which the \sc Lord\sc* giveth you.
Therefore shall ye lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be as frontlets between your eyes.
And ye shall teach them your children, speaking of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.
And thou shalt write them upon the door posts of thine house, and upon thy gates:
that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children, in the land which the \sc Lord\sc* sware unto your fathers to give them, as the days of heaven upon the earth.
For if ye shall diligently keep all these commandments which I command you, to do them, to love the \sc Lord\sc* your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cleave unto him;
then will the \sc Lord\sc* drive out all these nations from before you, and ye shall possess greater nations and mightier than yourselves.
Every place whereon the soles of your feet shall tread shall be yours: from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even unto the uttermost sea shall your coast be.

There shall no man \add be able to\add* stand before you: \add for\add* the \sc Lord\sc* your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he hath said unto you.
Behold, I set before you \add this\add* day a blessing and a curse;
a blessing, if ye obey the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc* your God, which I command you \add this\add* day:
and a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc* your God, but turn aside out of the way which I command you \add this\add* day, to go after other gods, which ye have not known.

And it shall come to pass, when the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath brought thee in unto the land whither thou goest to possess it, that thou shalt put the blessing upon mount Gerizim, and the curse upon mount Ebal.

\add Are\add* they not on the \add other\add* side Jordan, by the way where the sun goeth down, in the land of the Canaanites, which dwell in the champaign over against Gilgal, beside the plains of Moreh?
For ye shall pass over Jordan to go in to possess the land which the \sc Lord\sc* your God giveth you, and ye shall possess it, and dwell therein.
And ye shall observe to do all the statutes and judgments which I set before you \add this\add* day.
